channel.title: Compiler :S
channel.description: Well at first, my compiler started to work, then it stopped working for some reason. I compiled and nothing changed. What am I supposed to do to fix this?

item.title: Compiler :S
item.dc:creator: @Sw3das Sw3das
item.description:
@Sw3das wrote:

Oh man !

If you want that your compiler work just right-click on compiler.bat and press edit. Then write in there this :

@echo off
“%programfiles%\java\jdk1.6.0_21\bin\javac.exe” *.java
echo Who ho ! Your server compiled succsefully !
pause

Read full topic

item.title: Compiler :S
item.dc:creator: @doom_j doom_j
item.description:
@doom_j wrote:

If your server is in a different folder then your compiler, that could mean that the file you edited wasn’t added to the path for the compiler, like most packaged servers you have to add the location to the compiler or else the code isn’t looked at.

If you get errors that is another reason as to why your updates weren’t added, the code won’t be able to be used until you fix all your errors.

[quote=“RuneSpace, post:1, topic:364247”]Simple, but effective

paste this into your compiler

[quote]@echo off
Title Compiler
“C:/Program Files/Java/jdk1.6.0_##/bin/javac.exe” *.java
pause[/quote]

Replace the ## with your compiler version[/quote]

JDK is not a compiler, javac is.

[quote=“Jddogg9, post:2, topic:364246”]Or even better.

@echo off Title Compiling... javac *.java pause [/quote]

I doubt they even set their environment variables.

auzziejarrod:

LOL Or even better redownlaod JDK (Java Development Kit) that’s the guranteed way lol

Not true, re-downloading JDK might not even fix the problem.

Read full topic
